Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm Revolution, known in Japan as Naruto ShippÃ…Â«den: Narutimate Storm Revolution (Ã¯Â¼Â®Ã¯Â¼Â¡Ã¯Â¼Â²Ã¯Â¼ÂµÃ¯Â¼Â´Ã¯Â¼Â¯Ã¯Â¼ï¿½Ã£Æ’Å Ã£Æ’Â«Ã£Æ’Ë†Ã¯Â¼ï¿½ Ã§â€“Â¾Ã©Â¢Â¨Ã¤Â¼ï¿½ Ã£Æ’Å Ã£Æ’Â«Ã£Æ’â€ Ã£â€šÂ£Ã£Æ’Â¡Ã£Æ’Æ’Ã£Æ’Ë†Ã£â€šÂ¹Ã£Æ’Ë†Ã£Æ’Â¼Ã£Æ’Â  Ã£Æ’Â¬Ã£Æ’Å“Ã£Æ’ÂªÃ£Æ’Â¥Ã£Æ’Â¼Ã£â€šÂ·Ã£Æ’Â§Ã£Æ’Â³?) is a fighting game developed by CyberConnect2 and published by Namco-Bandai as part of the Naruto: Ultimate Ninja video game series, based on the manga "Naruto" by Masashi Kishimoto. It is a sequel to the 2013 game Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 3. The game was released on September 2014 in Japan,[1] North America, and Europe.

The game features a revamped fighting system. It includes new ways of forming teams based on their skills as well as counterattacks and guard breaks. Masashi Kishimoto worked in the game by providing the new character Mecha Naruto as well as new designs for the characters belonging to the organization Akatsuki whose back-stories are being told in this game. The game also includes a tournament mode where the player can battle against three CPU fighters at the same time. Players are also able to customize characters.
